'''Daniel McVicar''' (June 17, 1958; [[Independence, Missouri]]) is an American [[actor]], director and writer. He is known for his work on American and Italian television and film.
==Career== He played Captain William T. Bell in "Maschi contro Femmine" (2010) directed by Fausto Brizzi.
He played [[Rock Hudson]] in ''[[Dame Elizabeth Rosemond Taylor|Liz: The Elizabeth Taylor Story]]''.
He has played [[Clarke Garrison]] on ''[[The Bold and the Beautiful]]'' He has made 17 recurring appearances on ''[[The Late Late Show (CBS TV series)|The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'', where he is Craigâs nemesis at [[CBS Television City]].
His Italian work in 2009 includes Il Bene e il Male" for RAI Television which originally aired in February 2009. He played "Bob" in the film "L'Ispettore Coliandro" directed by The Manetti Bros and written by Carlo Lucarelli and "Innocenti e BuonaDonna" directed by Giulio Manfredonia.
He starred opposite [[Ben Gazzara]] in two projects, the television miniseries ''Woman on the Run'' where he worked opposite screen legend [[Gina Lollobrigida]], and ''A Kiss in the Dark'' with Garazza and Patricia Millardet, as well as starring in ''Under the Sky'' for filmmaker [[List of film directors from Italy|Angelo Antonucci]].
He was in''The Fourth Planet'', directed by award winning Russian filmmaker Dimitris Astrakhan. Although Daniel starred as American [[Astronaut]] Sam Straiton, the role called for him to speak entirely in Russian, which he had to learn while shooting on location in [[St. Petersburg]].
He was a contestant in the Italian version of Celebrity Survivor (L'Isola Dei Famosi).
He is a member of [[Mensa International|Mensa]].
== New media == McVicar started the McVlog video blog in July 2006 and hosted the first annual Vloggies Nov. 4, 2006.
His work in the new media has expanded to "The Late Nite Mash", an online show and creative community that has featured interviews with [[Andy GarcÃ­a]], music mashups with The Late Nite Mash musical director Joey Altruda and [[saxophone|saxophone player]] Plas Johnson [http://www.plasjohnson.com], integrated with community generated content from animators, vloggers and artists. Noteworthy episodes include a hangover remedy with French Maid Fifi and Freshtopia, and a discussion of the taser incident at UCLA with Mash experts Mistress Evolin and Mistress Abigail. He was named ''male vlogger of 2006'' by [[Lulu.tv]]
His media company MagmaWave.com is in Los Angeles and Turin, Italy.
== Personal ==
Married to international figure skating judge [[Virginia De Agostini]].
